arabicText: وَإِذْ نَجَّيْنَـٰكُم مِّنْ ءَالِ فِرْعَوْنَ يَسُومُونَكُمْ سُوٓءَ ٱلْعَذَابِ يُذَبِّحُونَ أَبْنَآءَكُمْ وَيَسْتَحْيُونَ نِسَآءَكُمْ ۚ وَفِى ذَٰلِكُم بَلَآءٌۭ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ عَظِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
. (And	 remember)	 When	 We	 rescued	 you	
from	 Firaun’s	 people,	 for	 they	 were	
inflicting	 you	 with	 a	 dreadful	 torment,	
slaying	 your	 sons	 and	 sparing	 your	
daughters;	 that	 was	 a	 tremendous	 trial	
from	your	Lord	(or	a	great	reward).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 yād	 karo	 jab	 ham	 ne	 tum	 ko	 fir'aun	
wālon	 se	 najāt	 bakhshi	 ke	 tum	 per	 bura	
‘azāb	 karte	 they	 tumhāre	 betoñ	 ko	 zibah	
karte	aur	tumhari	betiyoñ	ko	zinda	rakhte	
aur	 us	meiñ	 tumhāre	 rab	 ki	 taraf	 se	 badi	
balā	thi	ya	badā	in‘ām

arabicText: وَإِذْ فَرَقْنَا بِكُمُ ٱلْبَحْرَ فَأَنجَيْنَـٰكُمْ وَأَغْرَقْنَآ ءَالَ فِرْعَوْنَ وَأَنتُمْ تَنظُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. And	 when	 We	 split	 the	 sea	 for	 you	
thereby	 rescuing	 you,	 and	 drowned	 the	
Firaun's	people	in	front	of	your	eyes.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	Hum	ne	tumhāre	liye	darya	phārd	
diya	 to	 tumheiñ	 bacha	 liya	 aur	 fir'aun	
wālon	ko	tumhāri	āñkhoñ	ke	sāmne	dubo	
diya

arabicText: وَإِذْ وَٰعَدْنَا مُوسَىٰٓ أَرْبَعِينَ لَيْلَةًۭ ثُمَّ ٱتَّخَذْتُمُ ٱلْعِجْلَ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِۦ وَأَنتُمْ ظَـٰلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. And	 when	 We	 made	 a	 commitment	 with	
Moosa	 (Moses)	 for	 forty	 nights	 - then	
behind	 him	 you	 started	 worshipping	 the	
calf,	and	you	were	unjust.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 jab	 ham	 ne	 Mūsā se	 chālees	 rāt	 ka	
w'ada	 farmaya	phir	uske	peechhe	 tum	ne	
bachrde	 ki	 pooja	 shuru	 kardi	 aur	 tum	
zālim	they

arabicText: ثُمَّ عَفَوْنَا عَنكُم مِّنۢ بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Then	after	 that	We	pardoned	 you	so	 that	
you	may	be	grateful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	 iske	 b‘ād	 ham	 tumheiñ	 māfi	 di	 ke	
kahiñ tum	ehsān	māno

arabicText: وَإِذْ ءَاتَيْنَا مُوسَى ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَٱلْفُرْقَانَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَهْتَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 when	 We	 gave	 Moosa	 the	 Book	
(Taurat	 /	 Torah)	 and	 the	 criterion	 to	
judge	 right	 from	 wrong,	 so	 that	 you	may	
attain	guidance
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	 ham	 ne	Mūsā ko	Kitāb	ata	 ki	aur	
haq-o-bātil	me	 tameez	 kar	dena	 ke	 kahiñ
tum	rāh	per	āao.

arabicText: وَإِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِقَوْمِهِۦ يَـٰقَوْمِ إِنَّكُمْ ظَلَمْتُمْ أَنفُسَكُم بِٱتِّخَاذِكُمُ ٱلْعِجْلَ فَتُوبُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ بَارِئِكُمْ فَٱقْتُلُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَكُمْ ذَٰلِكُمْ خَيْرٌۭ لَّكُمْ عِندَ بَارِئِكُمْ فَتَابَ عَلَيْكُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلتَّوَّابُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	Moosa	said	to	his	people,	“O	my	
people!	 You	 have	wronged	 yourselves	 by	
taking	 the	 calf,*	 therefore	 turn	 in	
repentance	 to	your	Creator,	 therefore	kill	
each	 other;	 this	 is	 better	 for	 you	 before	
your	Creator”;	He	therefore	accepted	your	
repentance;	 indeed	 He	 only	 is	 the	 Most	
Acceptor	 of	 Repentance,	 the	 Most	
Merciful.	(*	as	your	deity	for	worship)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 jab	 Mūsā ne	 apni	 qaum	 se	 kaha	 aey	
meri	 qaum!	 Tum	 ne	 bachrda	 bana	 kar	
apni	 jānoñn	 per	 zulm	 kiya	 to	 apne	 paida	
karne	wāle	ki	taraf	ruju'	lao	to	āpas	meiñ	
ek	doosre	ko	qatl	karo	yeh	tumhāre	paida	
karne	 wāle	 ke	 nazdeek	 tumhare	 liye	
behtar hai	 usne	 tumhāri	 tauba	 qabool	 ki	
beshak	 wohi	 hai	 bahot	 tauba	 qabool	
karne	wāla	maherbān

arabicText: وَإِذْ قُلْتُمْ يَـٰمُوسَىٰ لَن نُّؤْمِنَ لَكَ حَتَّىٰ نَرَى ٱللَّهَ جَهْرَةًۭ فَأَخَذَتْكُمُ ٱلصَّـٰعِقَةُ وَأَنتُمْ تَنظُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	you	said	“O	Moosa!	We	will	not	believe	you	till	we	clearly	see	Allah”;	so	the	thunder	
seized	you	while	you	were	watching.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	tum	ne	kaha	aey	Mūsā!	Hum	hargiz	tumhāra	yaqeen	na	lāyeñge	jab	tak	a'lāniya	Khuda	
ko	na	dekh	leiñ to	tumheiñ	kadak	ne	āa	liya	aur	tum	dekh	rahe	they.

arabicText: ثُمَّ بَعَثْنَـٰكُم مِّنۢ بَعْدِ مَوْتِكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
englishTranslationText: Then	We	brought	you	back	to	life	after	your	death,	so	that	you	may	be	grateful
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	mare	peeche	Ham	ne	tumheiñ	zinda	kiya	ke	kahin	tum	ehsān	māno.

arabicText: وَظَلَّلْنَا عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلْغَمَامَ وَأَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلْمَنَّ وَٱلسَّلْوَىٰ ۖ كُلُوا۟ مِن طَيِّبَـٰتِ مَا رَزَقْنَـٰكُمْ ۖ وَمَا ظَلَمُونَا وَلَـٰكِن كَانُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ يَظْلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	made	the	clouds	a	canopy	for	you	and	sent	down	Manna	and	Salwa	(birds)	on	you;	“Eat	
of	the	pure	things	We	have	provided you”;	they	did	not	wrong	Us	in	the	least,	but	indeed	they	
wronged	themselves
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	ne	abr	 ko	 tumhāra	 sāye	 bān	 kiya	aur	 tum	per	Mań aur	Salwa utāra	 khāo	hamāri	di	
huyi	suthri	cheezeiñ	aur	unhoñ	ne	 kuch	hamāra	na	bighāda hāñ	apni	hi	jānoñ	 ka	bigād	 karte	
they

arabicText: وَإِذْ قُلْنَا ٱدْخُلُوا۟ هَـٰذِهِ ٱلْقَرْيَةَ فَكُلُوا۟ مِنْهَا حَيْثُ شِئْتُمْ رَغَدًۭا وَٱدْخُلُوا۟ ٱلْبَابَ سُجَّدًۭا وَقُولُوا۟ حِطَّةٌۭ نَّغْفِرْ لَكُمْ خَطَـٰيَـٰكُمْ ۚ وَسَنَزِيدُ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
. And	when	We	 said,	 “Enter	 this	 town	 and	
eat	freely	from	what	is	in	it,	and	enter	the	
gate	whilst	prostrating,	and	say,	‘May	our	
sins	 be	 forgiven’	 - We	 will	 forgive	 you	
your	 sins;	 and	We	will	 soon	increase	 the	
reward	for	the	righteous.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 jab	Ham	 ne	 farmaya	 us	 basti	 me	 jāo	
phir	 us	 meiñ	 jahān	 chāhoñ	 be	 rok-tok	
khāo	aur	darwāze	me	sajdah	karte	dakhil	
ho	 aur	 kaho	 hamāre	 gunah	 mu'af	 hoñ	
hum	tumhāri	khatāyeiñ	bakhsh	deñge	aur	
qareeb	 hai	 ke	 neki	 wāloñ	 ko	 aur	 ziyada	
deñ

arabicText: فَبَدَّلَ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ قَوْلًا غَيْرَ ٱلَّذِى قِيلَ لَهُمْ فَأَنزَلْنَا عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ رِجْزًۭا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَفْسُقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. But	the	unjust	changed	the	word	that	had	
been	ordered	for	another	one,	so	We	sent	
down	 a	 punishment	 on	 them	 from	 the	
skies,	 the	 recompense	 of	 their	
disobedience.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. To	zālimoñ	ne	aur	bāt	badal	di	jo	farmāyi	
gyi	thi	uske	siwa	to	ham	ne	āasman	se	un	
par	‘azāb	utāra	badla	unki	be-hukmi	ka

arabicText: وَإِذِ ٱسْتَسْقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ لِقَوْمِهِۦ فَقُلْنَا ٱضْرِب بِّعَصَاكَ ٱلْحَجَرَ ۖ فَٱنفَجَرَتْ مِنْهُ ٱثْنَتَا عَشْرَةَ عَيْنًۭا ۖ قَدْ عَلِمَ كُلُّ أُنَاسٍۢ مَّشْرَبَهُمْ ۖ كُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ مِن رِّزْقِ ٱللَّهِ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
. And	when	Moosa	asked	 for	water	 for	 his	
people,	 We	 said,	 “Strike	 this	 rock	 with	
your	 staff”;	 thereupon	 twelve	 springs	
gushed	 forth	 from	 it;	 each	 group	
recognised	 its	 drinking-place;	 “Eat	 and	
drink	 from	 what	Allah has	 provided,	 and	
do	 not	 roam	 about	 the	 earth	 making	
turmoil	in	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 jab	 Mūsā ne	 apni	 qaum	 ke	 liye	 pāni	
māñga	 to	ham	ne	 farmāya us	patthar	per	
apna	 ‘asā	 māro	 fauran	 us	 meiñ	 se	 bārah	
chashme	bah	nikle	har	giroh	ne	apna	ghāt	
pehchān	liya	khāo	aur	piyo	Khuda	ka	diya	
aur	zameen	meiñ	fasād	uthāte	na	phir

arabicText: وَإِذْ قُلْتُمْ يَـٰمُوسَىٰ لَن نَّصْبِرَ عَلَىٰ طَعَامٍۢ وَٰحِدٍۢ فَٱدْعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ يُخْرِجْ لَنَا مِمَّا تُنۢبِتُ ٱلْأَرْضُ مِنۢ بَقْلِهَا وَقِثَّآئِهَا وَفُومِهَا وَعَدَسِهَا وَبَصَلِهَا ۖ قَالَ أَتَسْتَبْدِلُونَ ٱلَّذِى هُوَ أَدْنَىٰ بِٱلَّذِى هُوَ خَيْرٌ ۚ ٱهْبِطُوا۟ مِصْرًۭا فَإِنَّ لَكُم مَّا سَأَلْتُمْ ۗ وَضُرِبَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلذِّلَّةُ وَٱلْمَسْكَنَةُ وَبَآءُو بِغَضَبٍۢ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ ۗ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ يَكْفُرُونَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ وَيَقْتُلُونَ ٱلنَّبِيِّـۧنَ بِغَيْرِ ٱلْحَقِّ ۗ ذَٰلِكَ بِمَا عَصَوا۟ وَّكَانُوا۟ يَعْتَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. And	 when	 you	 said,	 “O	 Moosa!	 We	 shall	
never	 put	 up	with	 only	 one	 kind	 of	 food,	
so	 call	 upon	 your	 Lord	 to	 produce	 for	 us	
what	 the	 earth	 grows	 - some	 herbs,	
cucumbers,	 corn,	 lentils	 and	 onions”;	 he	
said,	 “What!	 You	 wish	 to	 exchange	 the	
better	 for	 something	 inferior?	 Therefore	
settle	 down	 in	 Egypt	 or	 any	 city,	 where	 you	 will	 get	 what	 you	 demand”;	 and	 disgrace	 and	
misery	 were	 destined	 for	 them;	 and	 they	 returned	 towards	Allah’s	 wrath;	 that	 was	 because	
they	 disbelieved	 in	 Allah’s	 signs	 and	 wrongfully	 martyred	 the	 Prophets;	 that	 was	 for	 their	
disobedience	and	transgression.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Aur	jab	 tum	ne	kaha	aey	Mūsā hum	se	 to	
ek	khāne	per	harghiz	sabr	na	hoga	to	āap	apne	Rab	se	dua	kijiye	ke	zameen	ki	ugāi	hui	cheezeiñ	
hamāre	 liye	 nikāle,	 kuch	 sāg	 aur	 kakdi	 aur	 gehooñ aur	 masoor	 aur	 piyāz	 farmāya	 kiya	 adna	
cheez	 ko	 behtar	 ke	 badle	 māñgte	 ho	 achchha	Misr ya	 kisi	 shahar	 meiñ	 utro	 wahāñ tumheiñ	
milega	 jo	 tum	 ne	 mānga	 aur	 un	 per	 muqarrar	 kar	 di	 gayi	 khuwāri	 aur	 nadāri	 aur	Khuda	 ke	
ghazab	me	laute	yeh	badla	tha	iska	ke	woh	Allah	ki	āyatoñ	ka	inkār	karte	aur	ambiya	ko	na	haq	
shaheed	karte	yeh	badla	tha	un	ki	na	farmāniyoñ	aur	had	se	badhne	ka

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَٱلَّذِينَ هَادُوا۟ وَٱلنَّصَـٰرَىٰ وَٱلصَّـٰبِـِٔينَ مَنْ ءَامَنَ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلْيَوْمِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرِ وَعَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًۭا فَلَهُمْ أَجْرُهُمْ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ وَلَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	 the	 believers	 (the	 Muslims)	 and	
those	among	the	Jews,	the	Christians,	and	
the	Sabeans	who	sincerely	accept	 faith	in	
Allah and	 the	 Last	 Day	 *	 and	 do	 good	
deeds	 - their	 reward	 is	 with	 their	 Lord;	
and	there	shall	be	no	 fear	upon	them	nor	
shall	they	grieve.	(*	i.e.	convert	to	Islam)
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Beshak	 Īmān	 wāle	 neez	 Yahudioñ	 aur	
Nasrāniyoñ	 aur	 Sitāra	 parastoñ	 meiñ	 se	
woh	ke	sachche	dil	se	Allah	aur	pichle	din	
per	Īmān	lāyeiñ	aur	nek	kām	kareiñ	unka	
sawāb	un	ke	Rab	ke	pās	hai	aur	na	unheiñ	
kuch	andesha	ho	aur	na	kuch	gham

arabicText: وَإِذْ أَخَذْنَا مِيثَـٰقَكُمْ وَرَفَعْنَا فَوْقَكُمُ ٱلطُّورَ خُذُوا۟ مَآ ءَاتَيْنَـٰكُم بِقُوَّةٍۢ وَٱذْكُرُوا۟ مَا فِيهِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَتَّقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And when	We	made	a	covenant	with	you	
and	raised	 the	Mount	above	 you;	 “Accept	
and	 hold	 fast	 to	 what	 We	 give	 you,	 and	
remember	 what	 is	 in	 it,	 so	 that	 you	 may	
attain	piety.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Aur	jab	ham	ne	tum	se	‘ahed	liya	aur	tum	
par	 toor	 ko	 ooñcha	 kiya	 lo	 jo	 kuch	 ham	
tum	 ko	 dete	 haiñ	 zor	 se	 uske	 mazmoon	
yād	 karo	 is	 ummeed	 par	 ke	 tumheiñ	
parhez-gāri	mile

arabicText: ثُمَّ تَوَلَّيْتُم مِّنۢ بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ فَلَوْلَا فَضْلُ ٱللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ وَرَحْمَتُهُۥ لَكُنتُم مِّنَ ٱلْخَـٰسِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Then	 after	 that,	 you	 turned	 away;	 and	
were	 it	 not	 for	 the	 munificence	 of	 Allah
and	 His	 mercy,	 you	 would	 be	 among	 the	
losers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	uske	b‘ād	tum	phir	gaye	to	agar	Allah	
ka	 fazl	 aur	 uski	 rahmat	 na	 hoti	 to	 tum	
toote	(nuqsān)	wālon	me	ho	jāte

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْتُمُ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱعْتَدَوْا۟ مِنكُمْ فِى ٱلسَّبْتِ فَقُلْنَا لَهُمْ كُونُوا۟ قِرَدَةً خَـٰسِـِٔينَ
englishTranslationText:
. And	you	certainly	know	of	those	amongst	
you	 who	 transgressed	 in	 the	 matter	 of	
Sabth	(Sabbath	- Saturday)	- We	therefore	
said	to	them,	“Become	apes,	despised!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Aur	 beshak	 zaroor	 tumheiñ	 ma'loom	 hai	
tum	 meiñ	 ke	 woh	 jinhoñ	 ne	 hafte	 me	
sarkashi	ki	to	ham	ne	unse	farmaya	ke	ho	
jāo	Bandar	dhutkāre	huwe

arabicText: فَجَعَلْنَـٰهَا نَكَـٰلًۭا لِّمَا بَيْنَ يَدَيْهَا وَمَا خَلْفَهَا وَمَوْعِظَةًۭ لِّلْمُتَّقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	We	made	this	incident	(of	that	town)	a	
warning	to	the	surrounding	towns	(others	
of	 their	 time)	 and	 to	 succeeding	
generations,	and	a	lesson	for	the	pious.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	ham	ne	us	basti	ka	yeh	wāqia	uske	āge	
aur	peechhe	wālon	ke	liye	'ibrat	kar	diya	
aur	parhez-gāron	ke	liye	nasihat

arabicText: وَإِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِقَوْمِهِۦٓ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَأْمُرُكُمْ أَن تَذْبَحُوا۟ بَقَرَةًۭ ۖ قَالُوٓا۟ أَتَتَّخِذُنَا هُزُوًۭا ۖ قَالَ أَعُوذُ بِٱللَّهِ أَنْ أَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْجَـٰهِلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	(remember)	when	 Moosa	 said	 to	 his	
people,	 “Allah commands	 you	 to	 sacrifice	
a	cow”;	they	said,	“Are	you	making	 fun	of	
us?”	He	answered,	“Allah forbid	that	I	should	be	of	the	ignorant!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Aur	 jab	 Mūsā ne	 apni	 qaum	 se	 farmāya	
Khuda	 tumheiñ	hukm	deta	hai	ek	gāye	zibah	 karo	bole	 ke	āap	hameiñ	maskhara	banāte	haiñ	
farmāya	Khuda	ki	panāh	ki	mai	jāhilon	se	huñ

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ ٱدْعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ يُبَيِّن لَّنَا مَا هِىَ ۚ قَالَ إِنَّهُۥ يَقُولُ إِنَّهَا بَقَرَةٌۭ لَّا فَارِضٌۭ وَلَا بِكْرٌ عَوَانٌۢ بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ فَٱفْعَلُوا۟ مَا تُؤْمَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“Pray	to	your	Lord	that	He	may	describe	the	cow”;	said	Moosa,	“He	says	that	it	is	a	
cow	 neither	 old	 nor	 very	 young	 but	 between	 the	 two	 conditions;	 so	 do	 what	 you	 are	
commanded.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	apne	Rab	se	Dua	kijiye	ke	woh	hameiñ	bata	de	gāye	kaisi	kaha	woh	farmāta	hai	ke	wo	ek	
gāye	hai	na	boodhi	aur	na	ausar (Bachiya) balke	in	donoñ	ke	beech	meiñ	to	karo	jis	ka	tumheiñ	
hukm	hota	hai.

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ ٱدْعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ يُبَيِّن لَّنَا مَا لَوْنُهَا ۚ قَالَ إِنَّهُۥ يَقُولُ إِنَّهَا بَقَرَةٌۭ صَفْرَآءُ فَاقِعٌۭ لَّوْنُهَا تَسُرُّ ٱلنَّـٰظِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“Pray	to	your	Lord	that	He	may	reveal	its	colour	to	us”;	answered	Moosa,	“Indeed	He	
says	it	is	a	yellow	cow,	of	bright	colour,	pleasing	to	the	beholders.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Bole	apne	Rab	se	Dua	kijiye	hameiñ	bata	de	uska	rang	kiya	hai	kahā woh	 farmāta	hai	woh	ek	
peeli	gāye	hai	jiski	rangat	deh-dahāti	(Gehri	Chamak-dār)	dekhne	wālon	ko	khushi	deti

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ ٱدْعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ يُبَيِّن لَّنَا مَا هِىَ إِنَّ ٱلْبَقَرَ تَشَـٰبَهَ عَلَيْنَا وَإِنَّآ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ لَمُهْتَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“Pray	to	your	Lord	that	He	may	
clearly	 describe	 the	 cow	 to	 us,	 we	 are	
really	in	a	doubt	as	to	which	cow	it	is;	and	
if	Allah wills,	we	will	attain	guidance.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	 apne	 Rab	 se	 dua	 kijiye	 ke	 hamāre	
liye	 sāf	 bayān	 karde	 woh	 gāye	 kaisi	 hai	
beshak	 gāyoñ	 meiñ	 ham	 ko	 shub'h	 pad	
gya	 aur	 Allah	 chāhe	 to	 ham	 rāh	 pa	jāyeñ
ge

arabicText: قَالَ إِنَّهُۥ يَقُولُ إِنَّهَا بَقَرَةٌۭ لَّا ذَلُولٌۭ تُثِيرُ ٱلْأَرْضَ وَلَا تَسْقِى ٱلْحَرْثَ مُسَلَّمَةٌۭ لَّا شِيَةَ فِيهَا ۚ قَالُوا۟ ٱلْـَٔـٰنَ جِئْتَ بِٱلْحَقِّ ۚ فَذَبَحُوهَا وَمَا كَادُوا۟ يَفْعَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Said	 Moosa,	 “He	 says,	 ‘She	 is	 a	 cow	 not	
made	 to	work,	 neither	 ploughing	 the	 soil	
nor	 watering	 the	 fields;	 flawless	 and	
spotless’;	 they	 said,	 “You	 have	 now	
conveyed	 the	 proper	 fact”;	 so	 they	
sacrificed	 it,	 but	 seemed	 not	 to	 be	
sacrificing	it	(with	sincerity).
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Kaha	woh	farmāta	hai	ke	woh	ek	gāye	hai	
jis	ne	khidmat	nahi	li	jāti	ke	zameen	jotey	
aur	na	kheti	ko	pāni	de,	be-aib	hai	jis	meiñ	
koi	dāgh	nahi,	bole	ab āap	 theek	bāt	lāye	
to	 usey	 zibah	 kiya	 aur	 zibah	 karte	
ma'loom	na	hote	they

arabicText: وَإِذْ قَتَلْتُمْ نَفْسًۭا فَٱدَّٰرَْٰٔتُمْ فِيهَا ۖ وَٱللَّهُ مُخْرِجٌۭ مَّا كُنتُمْ تَكْتُمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 (remember)	 when	 you	 slew	 a	 man	
and	 were	 therefore	 accusing	 each	 other	
concerning	it;	and	Allah wanted	to	expose	
what	you	were	hiding.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Aur	jab	tum	ne	ek	khoon	kiya	to	ek	doosre	
per	 uski	 tohmat	 dālne	 lage	 aur	 Allah	 ko	
zahir	karna	tha	jo	tum	chupāte	they

arabicText: فَقُلْنَا ٱضْرِبُوهُ بِبَعْضِهَا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُحْىِ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ وَيُرِيكُمْ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
We	 therefore	 said,	 “Strike	 the	 dead	 man	
with	 a	 part	 of	 the	 sacrificed	 cow”;	 this	is	
how	Allah will	bring	 the	dead	 to	life,	and	
shows	 you	 His	 signs	 so	 that	 you																				
may	understand!
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	ham	ne	farmāya	us	maqtool	ko	us	gāye	
ka	 ek	 tukda	 māro	 Allah	 yuñ hi	 murde	
jilayega	 aur	 tumheiñ	 apni	 nishāniyañ	
dikhata	hai	ke	kahiñ	tumheiñ	aql	ho

arabicText: ثُمَّ قَسَتْ قُلُوبُكُم مِّنۢ بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ فَهِىَ كَٱلْحِجَارَةِ أَوْ أَشَدُّ قَسْوَةًۭ ۚ وَإِنَّ مِنَ ٱلْحِجَارَةِ لَمَا يَتَفَجَّرُ مِنْهُ ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ ۚ وَإِنَّ مِنْهَا لَمَا يَشَّقَّقُ فَيَخْرُجُ مِنْهُ ٱلْمَآءُ ۚ وَإِنَّ مِنْهَا لَمَا يَهْبِطُ مِنْ خَشْيَةِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَمَا ٱللَّهُ بِغَـٰفِلٍ عَمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Then after	 it,	 your	 hearts	 hardened	 - so	
they	 are	 like	 rocks,	 or	 even	 harder;	 for	
there	 are	 some	 rocks	 that	 rivers	 gush	
forth	 from	 them;	 and	 some	 that	 water	
flows	from	them	when	they	split	asunder;	
and	there	are	rocks	that	fall	down	for	the	
fear	of	Allah;	and	Allah is	not	unaware	of	
your	deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	is	ke	b‘ād	 tumhāre	dil	sakht	ho	gaye	
to	woh	pattharoñ ki misl	haiñ	balke	unse	
bhi	ziyada	karre	(sakht)	aur	pattharoñ me	
to	 kuchh	 woh	 haiñ	 jin	 se	 nadiyāñ bah	
nikalti	haiñ	aur	kuch	woh	haiñ	jo	phat	jāte	
haiñ	 to	 unse	 pāni	 nikalta	 hai	 aur	 kuchh	 wo	 haiñ	 jo	 Allah	 ke	 dar	 se	 gir	 padte	 haiñ	 aur	 Allah	
tumhāre	kautkoñ	(bure	kāmon)	se	be-khabar	nhi

arabicText: أَفَتَطْمَعُونَ أَن يُؤْمِنُوا۟ لَكُمْ وَقَدْ كَانَ فَرِيقٌۭ مِّنْهُمْ يَسْمَعُونَ كَلَـٰمَ ٱللَّهِ ثُمَّ يُحَرِّفُونَهُۥ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا عَقَلُوهُ وَهُمْ يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	O	Muslims,	do	you	wish	for	the	Jews	to	accept	faith	in	you	whereas	a	group	of	them	used	to	
listen	to	the	Words	of	Allah,	and	then	after	having	understood	it,	purposely	changed	it?
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	aey	Muslamanoñ	 kiya	 tumheiñ	 yeh	 tama'	 hai	 ke	 yahoodi	 tumhāra	 yaqeen	lāyeñ ge	aur	 un	
meiñ	ka	to	ek	giroh	woh	tha	ke	Allah	ka	kalām	sunte	phir	samajhne	ke	b‘ād	usey	dānista	badal	
dete

arabicText: وَإِذَا لَقُوا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ قَالُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا وَإِذَا خَلَا بَعْضُهُمْ إِلَىٰ بَعْضٍۢ قَالُوٓا۟ أَتُحَدِّثُونَهُم بِمَا فَتَحَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْكُمْ لِيُحَآجُّوكُم بِهِۦ عِندَ رَبِّكُمْ ۚ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	they	meet	the	believers,	they	say,	“We	believe”;	but	when	they	are	in	isolation	with	
one	another	 they	say,	 “You	clarify	 to	 the	believers	 from	what	Allah has	disclosed	 to	you,	so	
that	they	may	evidence	it	against	you	before	your	Lord?	So	have	you	no	sense?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	Musalmanoñ	se	mileiñ	to	kaheiñ	ham	Īmān	lāye	aur	jab	āpas	meiñ	akele	hoñ	to	kaheiñ	
woh	ilm	jo	Allah	ne	tum	par	khola	Musalmanoñ	se	bayan	kiye	dete	ho	ki usse	tumhāre	Rab	ke	
yahāñ	tumheiñ	per	hujjat	lāyeñ	kiya	tumheiñ	aql	nhi

arabicText: أَوَلَا يَعْلَمُونَ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ مَا يُسِرُّونَ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Do	 they	 not	 know	 that	 Allah knows	 all	
whatever	 they	 hide	 and	 whatever	 they	
disclose?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kiya	nahi	jānte	ke	Allah	jānta	hai	jo	kuch	
woh	chupāte	haiñ	aur	jo	kuch	zāhir	karte	
haiñ

arabicText: وَمِنْهُمْ أُمِّيُّونَ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ إِلَّآ أَمَانِىَّ وَإِنْ هُمْ إِلَّا يَظُنُّونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 among	 them	 are	 the	 unlearned	 that	
do	not	know	anything	of	 the	Book	except	
to	recite	something	 therefrom	or	parts	of	
their	 own	 fabrications;	 they	 are	 in			
absolute	illusion.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 un	 meiñ	 kuchh	 an-pardh	 haiñ	 ke	 jo	
kitāb	 ko	 nahi	 jānte	 magar	 zubāni	 padh	
lena	 ya	 kuch apni	 man	 gadhat	 aur	 woh	
nire	gumān	meiñ	haiñ

arabicText: وَمِنْهُمْ أُمِّيُّونَ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ إِلَّآ أَمَانِىَّ وَإِنْ هُمْ إِلَّا يَظُنُّونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 among	 them	 are	 the	 unlearned	 that	
do	not	know	anything	of	 the	Book	except	
to	recite	something	 therefrom	or	parts	of	
their	 own	 fabrications;	 they	 are	 in			
absolute	illusion.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 un	 meiñ	 kuchh	 an-pardh	 haiñ	 ke	 jo	
kitāb	 ko	 nahi	 jānte	 magar	 zubāni	 padh	
lena	 ya	 kuch apni	 man	 gadhat	 aur	 woh	
nire	gumān	meiñ	haiñ

arabicText: فَوَيْلٌۭ لِّلَّذِينَ يَكْتُبُونَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ بِأَيْدِيهِمْ ثُمَّ يَقُولُونَ هَـٰذَا مِنْ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ لِيَشْتَرُوا۟ بِهِۦ ثَمَنًۭا قَلِيلًۭا ۖ فَوَيْلٌۭ لَّهُم مِّمَّا كَتَبَتْ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَوَيْلٌۭ لَّهُم مِّمَّا يَكْسِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. Therefore	 woe	 is	 to	 those	 who	 write	 the	
Book	 with	 their	 hands;	 and	 they	 then	
claim,	“This	is	from	Allah”	in	order	to	gain	
an	 abject	(worldly)	 price	 for	 it;	 therefore	
woe	 to	 them	 for	 what	 their	 hands	 have	
written,	 and	 woe	 to	 them	 for	 what	 they	
earn	with	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. To	 kharābi	 hai	 unke	 liye	 jo	 kitāb	 apne	
hāth	se	likheñ	phir	kah	deñ	yeh	Khuda	ke	
pās	 se	 hai	 ke	iske	 'ewaz	 thode	 dām	 hāsil	
kareiñ	 to	 kharābi	 hai	 unke	 liye	 unke	
hāthoñ ke	 likhe	 se	 aur	 kharābi	 unke	 liye	
us	kamāi	se

arabicText: وَقَالُوا۟ لَن تَمَسَّنَا ٱلنَّارُ إِلَّآ أَيَّامًۭا مَّعْدُودَةًۭ ۚ قُلْ أَتَّخَذْتُمْ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ عَهْدًۭا فَلَن يُخْلِفَ ٱللَّهُ عَهْدَهُۥٓ ۖ أَمْ تَقُولُونَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. And	 they	said,	 “The	 fire	will	not	 touch	us	
except	for	a	certain	number	of	days”;	say,	
“Have	 you	 taken	 a	 covenant	 from	Allah -
then	 Allah will	 certainly	 not	 break	 His	
covenant	 - or	 do	 you	 say	 something	
concerning	Allah what	you	do	not know?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 bole	 hameñ to	Āg	 na	 chuwegi	magar	
ginti	 ke	 din	 tum	 farma	 do	 kiya	Khuda	 se	
tumne	 koi	 ‘ahed	le	 rakha	 hai	jab	 to	Allah	
hargiz	 apna	 ‘ahed	 khilāf	 na	 Karega	 ya	
khuda	par	woh	bāt	kahte	ho	jiska	tumheiñ	ilm	nahi
